results.title: Ways of studying children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Cuthbertson, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
Theories of child development go through phases with research leading to the formulation of new theories. The work of three psychologists is examined: first research on mother/child interaction, secondly styles of tutoring for pre-school children, and thirdly babies perception of containment.

results.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
It is not until 5 years old or so that children come to understand the notions of conservation of area, length and weight. This program, recorded at Nottingham primary school, examines the responses of three children to various Piagetian tests over a period of one year.

results.title: The Rocking horse winner
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, William Deneen, Learning Corporation of America and Highgate Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Adapted from a novel by D.H. Lawrence about a young boy whose rocking horse empowers him to predict winning racehorses at the eventual cost of his life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

group_siblings.title: Silver Blaze
group_siblings.creator_credit: John Davies and Highgate Association

results.title: Silver Blaze
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Called in to solve the baffling case involving the famous racehorse, Silver Blaze, Sherlock Holmes and Watson arrive at the small village of Tavistock to discover that the police have already arrested a suspect. However the detective uncovers discrepancies. He retraces the events of the night of the crime and ultimately comes to a surprising solution. Cast includes Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Jonathan Miller's London
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Dr Jonathan Miller gives his personal view of the historical development of the city of London including his own personal upbringing in that city.

results.title: Hildegard Knef's Berlin
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Hildegard Knef opens Berlin to the viewers of this film in an extensively historical yet highly personal manner. She introduces us to her personal family history and to the ramifications of Nazi power. The tour also includes historical footage of the “formidable women who cleaned up the rubble of demolished Berlin” after World War II, of John Kennedy’s famous speech declaring his Berlin citizenship, of the 15-foot-high concrete barricade that divides the city, and of the airlift that kept the city of two million people totally supplied.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions

results.title: John Huston's Dublin
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
A leisurely stroll through Dublin with John Huston, examining the uprising of 1916 through the plight of Ireland today.

results.title: Melina Mercouri's Athens
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
The vivacity of Melina Mercouri - singer, actress and parliamentarian, shines through as she reveals Athens as “a city with ancient ruins but with a heart that beats stronger than ever before”.
